page.title: 10CHANGING TIMES
page.content: Langton Green has changed immensely since it's birth. Miss Hayne who has lived here for 80 years has implements 7000 years old, such as flint scrapers and an axe head. Such things are not used today. The village has changed; although a lot of old cottages still stand, there are modern houses too. Barrow Lane which was once a packhorse track now has cars hurtling down it. Many years ago the main transport was horses but now bus services pass through the village. The inhabitants used to work locally but now a lot of them commute. There are now several shops along the main road including two small supermarkets; we also have amenities such as two pubs, a garage, a printers and an old peoples home. The old village school is still standing but is not in use, instead we have a modern village school.
